msContents.summary: Declaration of the family and possessions of Paesis, son of Nebteichis

msItemStruct.note: P. Mich. inv. 158 b; P. Oslo III 99

condition.ab: A light-brown papyrus of fine quality. The papyrus has been regularly cut to the shape of an upright capital H with a small strip of papyrus on the lower left side (opposite col. II l. 10) containing some line endings that represent the remains of column I. (TC)

handDesc.p: Written in a practiced and clear semicursive hand. (TC) Interval between the two columns is 2.5-3.0 cm.

origin.origPlace: Alabanthis, Arsinoite/Antinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, emperor

provenance.p: Alabanthis, Arsinoite/Antinoite nome, province of Egypt (?)

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: " [1-2 not read); of years] 40; [and there are in the possession of my wife Athe]nais; [daughter of Besis son of Harpechis shares in landed propert]y in the same; [Alabanthis and elsewhere]; there are other inherited shares of land]ed property and appurtenances; and I swear by the [Fortuna(?)] of Imperator Caes]ar; [Titus Aelius Hadrian]us Antoninus; [rest of column 1 is lost]. (TC) ;"From Paesis son of Nebteichis whose mother is Pachomis, from Alabanthis. In accordance with the instructions given by the ex-prefect Furius Victorinus, I declare for the house-by-house census of year 23 of our lord Antoninus Caesar: myself,;Paesis, son of Nebteichis, over-age 72 years; Horus my son whose mother is Athenais alias Kinna daughter of Besis, under-age in Year 23, 8 years; Women: Athenais alias Kinna, my wife 57 years; Tereus, my daughter, whose mother is the same; Athenais 40 years.;And there are in the possession of my wife Athenais daughter of Besis son of Harpechis shares in landed property in Alabanthis, and in other places other shares inherited from her father in other landed property and appurtenances. And I swear by the Fortuna of Imperator Caesar Titus Aurelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius . . ."

listBibl.bibl: Whitehorne J, Symbolae Osloenses 65, 140-1, 1990 -- SB XX 14666
